members.member:
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Constructor.
Loads the OnProject and OtherProject population files from the AppData directory. Since these tables do not indicate the start year of the population data, that must be passed. Default is 2000.
Thrown when an exception error condition occurs.
Full pathname to where WaterSim Data is located, same as WaterSimManager.DataDirectory. The start year of the population table, if zero Set to PopulationClass.DefaultStartYear.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

member.name: M:WaterSimDCDC.WaterSimManager.Simulation_Initialize
member.summary: Must be called to setup a Simulation . Simulation can be run in two ways, calling SimulationNextYear() for each year to be run, call SimulationAllYears() which runs all the years All simulations should be stopped with StopSimulation(), which will make sure all files are closed Will reset SimulationLock to false;

member.name: M:WaterSimDCDC.WaterSimManager.Simulation_NextYear
member.summary: Runs the next year in a series of years in a simulation, no pre or post process is evoked
member.returns: The year of the simulation run

member.name: M:WaterSimDCDC.WaterSimManager.runYear(System.Int32)
member.summary: Executes the year operation.
member.remarks: This has gone back and forth from protected to internal back again, might change in future

member.name: M:WaterSimDCDC.WaterSimManager.Simulation_AllYears
member.summary: Runs all years of the specified simulation
member.remarks: Runs each year. Before each year, except the first, it calls a preprocess processes. After each year, including the last it calls all postprocess processes. No data is retained. If a post process does not collect data fater each year, the only output data available will be that for the last year run.

member.remarks: Unlocks simulation, closes model files, unlocks base input parameters

member.name: F:WaterSimDCDC.WaterSimManager.Demand_Deficit
member.summary: The demand deficit
member.remarks: The annual difference between demand and supply (demand - supply), 0 if supply is larger than demand. Units AF. This is a good candidate as a indicator parameter. There are a number of management actions that can be taken, and reflected in the model parameters to manage water supplies and demand. A community's demand exceeding supply is an indicator of either a non-sustainable water resources budget or inadequate management of available water supplies and demand. Both indicate an unresolved water resource issue for the community. Currently there is no feedback in the model to reduce growth (thus demand growth) for a community when a demand deficit occurs, nor a feedback to allocate this growth to other providers.

member.summary: The use surface water to water bank
member.remarks: The amount of water (source unknown) sent to a water bank if [WaterBank Source Option] is set to a Value=2. Range = 0 to 100000. member.name: P:WaterSimDCDC.WaterSimManager.Provider_Demand_Option
member.summary: Gets or sets the provider demand option.
member.value: The provider demand option.
member.remarks: The method that will be used to estimate annual demand for all providers. Value=1 reads demand values from an external file, Value=2 calculates demand based on a six year average GPCD and population read from a file, Value=3 estimates demand based on population estimates read from and external file and a smoothing function that slowly declines GPCD, Value=4 uses same method as 3, but allows the user to chnage the GPCD with Use_GPCD Paramtere used for each provider at the beginning or during the simulation. Range = 1 to 4 Cannot be set after Simulation starts.
member.exception: if setting a value that does not pass the range check

member.name: P:WaterSimDCDC.WaterSimManager.PCT_Reduce_GPCD
member.summary: Gets or sets the Percent to Reduce GPCD.
member.value: The percent reduction in gpcd.
member.remarks: The amount by which GPCD is expected to decrease by the end of the simulation (i.e., 2085). Use this when Provider Demand Option is = 3 or Provider Demand Option=4.

member.name: M:WaterSimDCDC.WaterSimManager_DB.Valid_DataTable(System.Data.DataTable)
member.summary: Check if Valid WaterSimManager_DB datatable
member.returns: true if valid otherwise false
member.remarks:
Checks if the DataTable has the required fields to be a valid WaterSimManager data table. Five fields are required and constants are provided for these five fields, rdbfID, rdbfScenarioName, rdbfSimYear , rdbfProviderLabel, and rdbfProviderCode. Below is SQL command syntax for creating such a table.
OleDbConnection dbConnect = new OleDbConnection(MyConnectionstring); OleDbCommand cmd = dbConnect.CreateCommand(); cmd.CommandText = "CREATE TABLE [MYTABLENAME] ("+ rdbfID + "COUNTER PRIMARY KEY, "+ rdbfScenarioName + " CHAR(50), "+ rdbfSimYear + " INT, "+ rdbfProviderLabel + " CHAR(25), "+ rdbfProviderCode + " CHAR(5) )" cmd.ExecuteNonQuery();

member.name: M:WaterSimDCDC.WaterSimManager_DB.LoadScenario_DB(System.String,System.Int32,System.Data.DataTable,WaterSimDCDC.SimulationInputs@)
member.summary: Loads a scenario nput Parameters from a database.
member.remarks: This method will load Input Model Parameters (BaseInput and ProviderInput) into a SimulationInputs struct. The Datatable must be a valid WaterSimManager_DB datatable (see Valid_DataTable However fields for all input parameters do not need to be in the Datatable. This method will load whatever ModelParameter.Fieldname fields it finds. It does not set values in sInputs struct for Model Parameters it finds. It is good practice to fill the sInputs struct with the models current input values before passing it to this method. See example
member.param: Name of the scenario, if empty (="") then the first scenario found is used.
The year. If 0 then the first year found is used
member.returns: true if it succeeds, false if it fails. If false check isError and GetErrorMessage()
member.exception: when Source datatable is not a valid WaterSimManager_DB datatable.

It is good practice to fill the sInputs struct with the models current input values before passing it to this method. See example
member.param: Name of the scenario, if empty (="") then the first scenario found is used.
The year. If 0 then the first year found is used
a ParameterManagerClass object to iteratre through known parameters and see if they are in the datatable

members.member: ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Create a Model Document Tree. Creates a DocTreeNode Tree populated with Model information using WSim, tree includes parameters and processes The WaterSimManager node is based on a DocTreeNode with model info -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

---------------------------------------------------------------*---------------------------------- Create a Parameter Document tree. Creates a DocTreeNode Tree populated with just Parameter information using the ParmManager The ParameterManagerClass used to create Node. The label for the node. a DocTreeNode with parameters . -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Create Process Document Tree. Creates a DocTreeNode Tree populated with just Process information using the ProcManager ProcessManager used to create Tree. DocTreeNode with Processes. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

member.summary: The provider aggregated estimate of inflow in the SRV basin. This is the mountain front estimates from the SRV model report number 19, Figure 3.2 (ADWR April 2009)

member.name: P:WaterSimDCDC.WaterSimU.get_RegionalAgOtherPumping

member.name: P:WaterSimDCDC.WaterSimU.get_RegionalProviderRecharge
member.summary: At present the only recharge we do at the SRV basin scale is direct injection estimates simulated.

member.name: P:WaterSimDCDC.WaterSimU.get_RegionalAgToVadoseFlux
member.summary: At present this is only the portion of groundwater pumped; no surface water, other than effluent, is simulated.

member.name: P:WaterSimDCDC.WaterSimU.get_RegionalGroundWaterBalance
member.summary: This is the Phoenix AMA, or more closely the SRV basis regional groundwater budget. Annual balance from the 33 Water providers... two- no provider and other provider - are not considered.

member.name: P:WaterSimDCDC.WaterSimU.get_RegionalNaturalRecharge
member.summary: Natural recharge includes SRP and CAP canal leakage into the vadose, mountain front not accounted for by Figure 3.2 (see above), leakage into the stream from flood events .

member.name: P:WaterSimDCDC.WaterSimU.get_VadoseToAquiferFlux
member.summary: Provider-specific estimates of recharge from City Model. This includes all fluxes from the vadose to the aquifer. Consult with the City-model Figure to ascertain the specific fluxes.

member.name: P:WaterSimDCDC.WaterSimU.get_WaterCreditIncidental
member.summary: The annual credit for vadose water from residential, commercial, and industrial water users. This is the outdoor water not evapotranspired.

member.name: P:WaterSimDCDC.WaterSimU.get_WaterCreditsAgAdded
member.summary: March 1, 2014

member.name: P:WaterSimDCDC.WaterSimU.get_WaterCreditsTotalAdded
member.summary: March 1, 2014

member.name: P:WaterSimDCDC.WaterSimU.get_WaterCreditTotals
member.summary: The total credit balance for groundwater credits. Please refer to the credit model Figure for additional information. Labeled Figure two in the xls documentation. i.e., Version 5.7 Parameters ver 5.xlsx file.

member.name: P:WaterSimDCDC.WaterSimU.get_WaterCreditDeficits
member.summary: The annual difference between the annual pumping credits and the demand for water at the time-step. i.e., the demand for groundwater not satisfied by the annual credits allowed. 09.05.12

member.name: P:WaterSimDCDC.WaterSimU.get_CAP_BO
member.summary: Total CAP delivered along the aqueduct. Colorado River Arizona share minus on-river uses and losses to evaporation.

member.name: P:WaterSimDCDC.WaterSimU.get_MeadElevation
member.summary: Elevation of Lake Mead in feet above msl.

member.name: P:WaterSimDCDC.WaterSimU.set_ColoradoTrace
member.summary: The length of the river trace to use, in years, for the Colorado River historical or paleo flows. The default, now, is 30 years. It was 25 years in previous versions of WaterSim.

member.name: P:WaterSimDCDC.WaterSimU.ColoradoHistoricalData
member.summary: The river data to use. See the WaterSim xlsx documentation. i.e., Version 5.7 Parameters ver 5.xlsx. 1=Bureau of Reclamation, 2=Paleo, 3=Scenario data (user defined- 85-year record).

member.name: P:WaterSimDCDC.WaterSimU.ColoradoHistoricalExtractionStartYear
member.summary: The "index" year to use. I.e., the start of the (default) 30-year trace from the historical or paleo data for river runoff.

member.name: P:WaterSimDCDC.WaterSimU.ColoradoUserAdjustmentStartYear
member.summary: The year that a user imposed drought on the system begins. This, of course, for the Colorado River System. This must be greater than the start year and less than the end year.

member.name: P:WaterSimDCDC.WaterSimU.ColoradoUserAdjustmentStopYear
member.summary: The year that a user imposed drought on the Colorado River System stops. This must be greater than the start year and greater than the simulation start but less than the end year.

member.name: P:WaterSimDCDC.WaterSimU.ColoradoUserAdjustmentPercent
member.summary: The change in the Colorado River flow (positive or negative) during a drought. This is evaluated as a percent of the historical (or paleo) record.

member.name: P:WaterSimDCDC.WaterSimU.ColoradoClimateAdjustmentPercent
member.summary: The change in the Colorado River Flow (positive or negative) over the course of a simulation. This now operates as a variable change that reaches the estimated amount by a year set using the property "ClimateFactorEndYear." That is, now it is evaluated as a gradual reduction (or increase) achieved by the "EndYear."

member.name: P:WaterSimDCDC.WaterSimU.get_UpperBasinDeliveries
member.summary: Gets the get upper basin deliveries.
member.value: The get upper basin deliveries. Units are acre-feet

member.name: P:WaterSimDCDC.WaterSimU.set_upperBasinData
member.summary: Sets the information describing the data for the upper basin estimate.
member.value: Value=2 is the 2007 Upper Colorado River Comission schedule, value=3 is the ADWR Arizona Upper Basin Depletion schedule, value=4 is the model estimate (Tim Lant original estimate).

member.name: P:WaterSimDCDC.WaterSimU.get_SaltVerdeTrace
member.summary: Gets the get salt-tonto verde trace. Separate from the set because this is a testing variable
member.value: The get salt verde trace. 07.26.13 das

member.name: P:WaterSimDCDC.WaterSimU.SaltVerdeTontoHistoricalData
member.summary: The river data to use. See the WaterSim xlsx documentation. i.e., Version 5.7 Parameters ver 5.xlsx. 1=Bureau of Reclamation, 2=Paleo, 3=Scenario data (user defined- 85-year record).

member.name: P:WaterSimDCDC.WaterSimU.SaltVerdeHistoricalExtractionStartYear
member.summary: The "index" year to use. I.e., the start of the (default) 30-year trace from the historical or paleo data for river runoff.

member.name: P:WaterSimDCDC.WaterSimU.SaltVerdeUserAdjustmentStartYear
member.summary: The year that a user imposed drought on the system begins. This, of course, for the Salt-Verde-Tonto River System. This must be greater than the start year and less than the end year.

member.name: P:WaterSimDCDC.WaterSimU.SaltVerdeUserAdjustmentStopYear
member.summary: The year that a user imposed drought on the Salt-Verde-Tonto River System stops. This must be greater than the start year and greater than the simulation start but less than the end year.

member.name: P:WaterSimDCDC.WaterSimU.SaltVerdeUserAdjustmentPercent
member.summary: The change in the Salt-Verde-Tonto River flow (positive or negative) during a drought. This is evaluated as a percent of the historical (or paleo) record. i.e., 90 would create a 10% reduction in flows on the system during a drought period.

member.name: P:WaterSimDCDC.WaterSimU.SaltVerdeClimateAdjustmentPercent
member.summary: The change in the Salt-Verde-Tonto River Flow (positive or negative) over the course of a simulation. This now operates as a variable change that reaches the estimated amount by a year set using the property "ClimateFactorEndYear." That is, now it is evaluated as a gradual reduction (or increase) achieved by the "EndYear."

member.summary: The parameter used to chage the population growth rate for all providers at once. This variable is not currently used.

member.summary: Gets or sets the provider Population growth rate adjust pct.

member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether the parameter calculate gray water should be set.
member.value: true if set parameter calculate gray water, false if not.

member.name: P:WaterSimDCDC.WaterSimU.ClimateFactorEndYear
member.summary: This is the year at which the imposed climate change factor for either the Colorado River System, or the Salt-Verde-Tonto River System achieves the value set by ColoradoClimateAdjustmentPercent or SaltVerdeClimateAdjustmentPercent. Thus, a gradual change in the runoff modifiers reaches the set value by the ClimateFactorEndYear (at present, one value for both river systems).

member.name: P:WaterSimDCDC.WaterSimU.ModifyProviderNormalFlowPct
member.summary: Property to modify the Trott table- bypassing the 1910 statute whereby the user tells the model the acre-feet per acre that class A member lands will receive as normal flow (from the daily flow estimate and the daily table that uses cfs by provider by flow threshold Use values ranging from 1 (0.1) to 55 (5.5) acre-feet per acre-1. Note that 55 reverts to 5.4288 within the model [maximum- equilivent to 0.3 Miners inches per acre-1 as set in the 1910 decree]

member.summary: Gets or sets the parameter reclaimed waste water to the RO plant.

member.name: P:WaterSimDCDC.WaterSimU.parmEffluentToVadosePct
member.summary: Gets or sets the parameter effluent to vadose pct.
member.value: The parameter effluent to vadose pct. Units are percent (0 to 100).

member.name: P:WaterSimDCDC.WaterSimU.parmEffluentToPowerPlantPct
member.summary: Gets or sets the parameter effluent to power plant pct.
member.value: The parameter effluent to power plant pct. Units are percent (0 to 100). Together, with effluent to vadose, the remaining goes to Agriculture.

member.name: P:WaterSimDCDC.WaterSimU.parmReclaimedToVadosePct
member.summary: Gets or sets the parameter reclaimed to vadose pct. This is the reclaimed water sent to the vadose. Four paths for Reclaimed water: 1) to output (to be used in the next simulation year, 2) direct injection (into the aquifer, 3) to the vadose (time lag before it reaches the aquifer, or 4) the difference (to regional waste water surfaces discharge- to the environment.
member.value: The parameter reclaimed to vadose pct. In apposition to reclained to direct injection, and to output, all three may add to a value of 100. If not, the remaining goes to the surface discharge (units are percent- 0 to 100).

member.name: P:WaterSimDCDC.WaterSimU.parmReclaimedToDirectInjectPct
member.summary: Gets or sets the parameter reclaimed to direct inject pct. Four paths for Reclaimed water: 1) to output (to be used in the next simulation year, 2) direct injection (into the aquifer, 3) to the vadose (time lag before it reaches the aquifer, or 4) the difference (to regional waste water surfaces discharge- to the environment.
member.value: The parameter reclaimed to direct inject pct. Reclaimed water can go to output, or to vadose, or to direct injection. The remaining (if less than 100) goes to Regional Waste Water Surfaces Discharge.

member.name: P:WaterSimDCDC.WaterSimU.get_parmOverrideShortage

member.name: P:WaterSimDCDC.WaterSimU.parmReclaimedToOutputPct
member.summary: Gets or sets the parameter reclaimed to output pct. Four paths for reclaimed water: 1) to output (to be used in the next simulation year, 2) direct injection (into the aquifer, 3) to the vadose (time lag before it reaches the aquifer, or 4) the difference (to regional waste water surfaces discharge- to the environmen.t
member.value: The parameter reclaimed to output pct.

member.name: P:WaterSimDCDC.WaterSimU.KernelCase
member.summary: The case construct in the model kernel which tells the model what order to use when satisfying demand from the various sources. At present we have to options: CASE 1 call sSRP_classA(T,gvi,Aout) call sSRP_classBandCstorage(T,gvi,Aout) call sCAP_water(T,gvi,Sout%sCAP_maf,vPV) call sSRP_classBandC(T,gvi,Aout,vPV) call sSRP_NCS(T,gvi,Aout) call sGWater(T,gvi) call sBanking_k(T,gvi,lvl_Interrupt) CASE 2 call sSRP_classA(T,gvi,Aout) call sCAP_water(T,gvi,Sout%sCAP_maf,vPV) call sSRP_classBandCstorage(T,gvi,Aout) call sSRP_classBandC(T,gvi,Aout,vPV) call sSRP_NCS(T,gvi,Aout) call sGWater(T,gvi) call sBanking_k(T,gvi,lvl_Interrupt)

member.name: T:WaterSimDCDC.ModelParameterClass
member.summary: Model parameter class.
member.remarks: This class allows for flexible use (iteration across all obaject) of all parameter classes managed by the parameter for those experienced in using the different types of parameters and what type of prarameter will be returned by each method and property of the parameter manager. However, this class is less preferred than the individual parameter classes. Evntually the access properties and methods in this class that are specific to individual model parameter types will be deprecated, thus using the individual parameter classes is advised. These provide higher level of type and method safe use with out generating exceptions. Use of object created from this class in a manner not appropriate for the specific model parameter type (inputbase,outputnase, providerinput, provideroutout, grid, etc) can generate exceptions. This is the heart of the ModelParameter management system. Each parameter for the Fortran model exposed in the API has a unique ModelParameter object..

members.member: Parameter manager class. / This class is used by the WaterSimManager class to manage the model parameters. It can be access from a WaterSimManager object through the ParamManager property The constructor is not exposed becuase only the WaterSimManager constructor should instantiate an object of this class. The AddPArameter method is also not exposed at this time. The intent is to evntually allow user define parameters to be added.

member.name: M:WaterSimDCDC.ParameterManagerClass.GetSimulationInputs
member.summary: Gets All Simulation Input Values from the model and returns them in a SimulationInputs struct
member.remarks: Some foresight should be used with this method. This reads the input parameters regardless of the state of the model. Though BaseInputs can not be changed once a Simulation has started, the provider inputs can, so the values of these can change from one annual run to another.
member.returns: all current input parmeter values in a SimulationInputs struct

member.name: M:WaterSimDCDC.ParameterManagerClass.SetSimulationInputs(WaterSimDCDC.SimulationInputs)
member.summary: Sets all model parameter values using values in a SimulationInputs struct
member.remarks: Some caution should be used with this method, a true return value only means thet values were in range, not that the ModelParameters were actually set. Write access to baseinputs is blocked once a Simulation starts. Attempting to set them at this Simulation state will not succeed, but will return a true value and evoke no exception. Though teh order of the modelparameter arrays is controled by the order of the enum, there is no guarantee that they will come into this method in that order. Thusthis method does not use the parameter iteratires, istead it uses the eModelParam values in the BaseInputModelParam and ProviderInputModelParam to fetch the appropriate ModelParamter to set its value. This means the these eModelParm values must be set (which GetSimulationInputs does do) if this returns false, then erros ocurred, and GetSetSimulationErros() can be used to retrieve a lits of errors.
member.returns: true if no errors, including range errors, otherwise false if errors

member.name: M:WaterSimDCDC.ParameterManagerClass.Model_ParameterBaseClass(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retreives the ModelParameter based on eModelParam value.
member.exception: Thrown when invlaid eModelParam is used for p.
member.remarks: This is the primary way to access specific ModelParameters. Each ModelParameter has a unique eModelParam value that can be used to identify and access each ModelParameter.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Constructor
The name of the process The WaterSimManager Using the Process. It should not be assumed that the WaterSimManager value being passed is the WaterSimManager that will make' pre and post process calls -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Constructor This is intended to be an interactive constructor where at least a prompt for a name is used It should not be assumed that the WaterSimManager value being passed is the WaterSimManager that will make' pre and post process calls The WaterSimManager Using the Process. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Constructor. This is intended to be an interactive constructor where normally a dialog prompt for a name or initial values is used to set initial values, however, if quite is true, then this prompt is not used and default values are used. It should not be assumed that the WaterSimManager value being passed is the WaterSimManager that will make' pre and post process calls /// The WaterSimManager Using the Process. true to quiet. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Constructor. Uses InstanceData string to setup Object field values usinge SetupProcess() The name of the process. Information describing the instance. The WaterSimManager Using the Process. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Sets up the process data using InstanceData string.
THis method parce the InstanceData string to set the objects fields after a basic create
Information describing the instance. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources. Best not redefine this with a custon dispose, use Clenup for that. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- method that is called when a Simulation is initialized. The WaterSimManager that is making call. Override this method to do some activity before the simulation starts AT this point, the WSim ParamManager methods are available and set to their default values but note that none of the values of parameters from WaterSim are reliable at this point since they can all be set before the simulation actually starts, to do some activity before the first year is run, but after all values have been set, refer to ProcessStarte.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- method that is called right before the first year of a simulation is called. The year about to be run The WaterSimManager that is making call. true if it succeeds, false if it fails. Year is the first year fo the simulation. Input parameters available at this point have been set for the Simulation, however ther is output data since the model has not yet been run (ie Output values are not meaningful) -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Method that is called before each annual run The year about to be run The WaterSimManager that is making call true if it succeeds, false if it fails. Error should be placed in FErrorMessage Override this method to do some activity after each annual run. The first year does not call this Preprocess -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Method that is called before after each annual run The year just run The WaterSimManager that is making call true if it succeeds, false if it fails. Error should be placed in FErrorMessage Override this method to do some activity after each annual run To test if this is the first year use (year == Wsim.Simulation_Start_Year) To test if this is the last year use (year == Wsim.Simulation_End_Year) -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Gets a description of the process class. A Static property that returns a description of the class. For each new derived class, this should change The description of the process class. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

members.member: ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Raises the process manager process event. This should be used primarily for debugging purposes. This event gets called five times during each annual run of the WaterSim simulation, which can amount to hudreds of calls, thus slowing down the simulation Event information to send to registered event handlers. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Adds a process to the ProcessManager list if aProcess is null, or a process of the same class type is already in the Process que, the process is not added and this routinne returns false. Once an AnnualFeedbackProcess objet has been added to the ProcessManager, the ProcessManager is the owner of the process object. This means when it is deleted, its dispose method is called. a process. true if it succeeds, false if it fails (only failure is if aProcess is null. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Deletes the given ProcessName from list of processes being managed Also calls the Process' Dispose method, since the Manager Owns it and no longer will have access to it. ProcessManagerEvent is called with ProcessEventType.peDisposeProcess after it is removed from the list but before it is disposed. Name of the process. true if it succeeds, false if it fails. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Deletes the given ProcessName from list of processes being managed Also calls the Process' Dispose method, since the Manager Owns it and no longer will have access to it. ProcessManagerEvent is called with ProcessEventType.peDisposeProcess after it is removed from the list but before it is disposed. Feedback Process true if it succeeds, false if it fails. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Call the ProcessStarted method of all Processes being managed Process the started all. The year. The WaterSimManger simulation.
true if it succeeds, false if it fails. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Gets a value indicating how many errors occurred during a Simulation. If there is an error, ErrorMessages contains a list of the errors ("Stage:ClassName:ErrorMessage") The error flag is reset with a ProcessInitialize call, errors from a previous siumulation runs are cleared at the start of a new simulation. Number of errors that occurred during process. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Values that represent eProviderAggregateMode.
These values indicate how a parameter should be summarized at a regional level based on individual provider values. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

member.summary: Sum all the providers.

member.summary: Average all the providers.

member.name: F:WaterSimDCDC.eProviderAggregateMode.agWeighted
member.summary: Average all the providers by weighting each based on demand.

member.name: T:WaterSimDCDC.eProvider
member.summary: enum values for each of the Water Providers
member.remarks: This is a key enumerator for all the provide input and output paramters, data stored in provider arrays is stored in the order of these enum values. Most provider data structures allow indexing based on these enum values and the ProviderClass provides an IEnumerator that returns enum values using a foreach () loop. The exception to this is the providers past the ProviderClass.LastProvider eProvider value which are not considered a valid provider by most routines Test for a valid provider using ProviderClass.valid(int index)

member.name: T:WaterSimDCDC.SimulationInputs
member.summary: Struct to hold base and Provider Inputs
member.remarks: The ParameterManagerClass provides a method to create this struct without passing sizes to the constructor. This is a dynamic class and the contents and structure are not static. Even when constructed with the ParamManager method the contents can be dynamic over time. For example, if a SimulationInputs object is created, and then an input parameter is added (or deleted) using the ParamManger, the next object created with NewSimulationInputs will be different.

example.code: WaterSimManager WSim = new WaterSimManager("Temp","Data"); SimulationInputs MySI = WSim.ParamManager.NewSimulationInputs();

member.name: M:WaterSimDCDC.ReportClass.AnnualFullData(WaterSimDCDC.WaterSimManager,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Annual full data.
member.remarks: returns an array of strings, one string for each provider with the value of all parameters in order to match report header. Essentiall the report header strings plus these strings is all the input and output data for one Simulation year. Reads the current data from the paramters for the WaterSimManager class object passed.
member.param: The WaterSimManager class object being used for Simulation.
true to use tabs otherwise pads with spaces.
